title: PYP Coordinator
body:
AMADEUS International School Vienna
Application Package: PYP (Primary Years Programme) Coordinator (f/m)




stContract Date: 1 August 2020
Application Closing Date: 25 May 2020
Employment: Full-time


AMADEUS INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL VIENNA is a young, unique and dynamic IB World School (PYP, MYP and DP) located in
heritage listed buildings on a beautiful campus in Vienna. We strive to create a strong sense of community, which allows
students to discover their talents during the education process. With a strong commitment to creativity and performance
throughout the school, AMADEUS has a dedicated Academy of Music and the Arts. Our excellent boarding facilities host
students from around the world as part of a school community of more than 45 nationalities. Our family-style boarding houses
build a sense of community and cater for both boys and girls between Grades 6 to 12.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

School Administration:
- Promote child protection and safeguarding school wide
  • Uphold and promote the school mission, vision, values, pillars of educational distinction, and behavioral framework
  • Promote the positive, collaborative, and professional culture of the school section based on the learner profile
  • Promote international mindedness and global citizenship throughout the school section
  • In collaboration with the Head of Secondary, put measures in place for quality assurance of the teaching and learning
within the school program according to the school’s definition of high-quality teaching and learning and the relevant
IB programme
  • Maintain a highly-visible profile in the relevant school section and provide regular instructional leadership to faculty
  • In collaboration with the Head of Secondary, monitor student learning and wellbeing outcomes and contribute to the
development of strategies for continual improvement
  • In collaboration with the Heads of Primary and Secondary, coordinate with other Curriculum Coordinators for
oversight of the relevant transitions into, out of, and between programs
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary maintain oversight of students’ access to, and progress through, student
academic and pastoral support (counseling, SEN, EAL, SSST)
  • Ensure clear and consistent communication of learning outcomes with parents, online and via parent evenings
(including scope and sequence and assessment and reporting timeframes)
  • Participate as a member of the School Educational Leadership Team and support in steering the work of the

Department Coordinators (including by lending support and recommendation toward to budgeting, planning,

scheduling, project execution and resource allocation)

  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary support the consistent implementation of the school behavioral

expectations

  • Oversee all standardized testing and summative examinations, group projects and graduation requirements as relevant
  • Contribute to safety processes including building security, emergency procedures, transportation, evacuations,
lockdowns and fire drills
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, develop the timetable for the relevant section.
  • Record relevant data for use in educational decision making








AMADEUS International School Vienna
Application Package: PYP (Primary Years Programme) Coordinator (f/m)

Program Coordination:
- Act as the liaison person between the IBO and the School on all matters pertaining to the relevant programme

(PYP/MYP/DP)
- Ensure that all requirements of the IB concerning implementation of the program are adhered to
- Ensure an outstanding educational experience of the relevant program for learners and their families which is
enhanced by AMADEUS’ unique mission, vision and context - Publish articles pertaining to the relevant programme within school publications
  • Ensure the full and coherent articulation and documentation of the program (PYP/MYP/DP) utilizing ManagBac
  • Ensure access to, and completion of, relevant training needs of staff as specified by the IBO; including advising the
Head of Primary of training needs and facilitating workshop, conferences, school visits etc.
  • Take the lead in all relevant aspects of the IBO reaccreditation processes and other IBO requirements
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, provide quality assurance of the reporting process for the relevant school
section

REQUIREMENTS
Essential:
  • Master in Education or equivalent
  • Has outstanding programme knowledge
  • Demonstrated excellent pedagogical practice and approaches to teaching and learning
  • Has a track record of high student attainment
  • High standards
  • Excellent organisational and communication skills
  • Deep commitment to the IB philosophy
Desirable:
  • Previous leadership experience in a similar position
  • Experience as a subject/component examiner (or similar)
  • Excellent IT literacy and competence with information management systems

WHAT WE OFFER

  • A welcoming and inclusive work environment with a sense of mission and community
  • Long-term employment in an international company as well as other positive benefits
  • Ability to be involved in a variety of projects as well as community activities
  • Attractive working environment within an open and warm community
  • The salary, depending on qualifications and experience, follows the current salary scale with a minimum gross
monthly salary of 3,100.00 EUR (14 times a year) for an employment based on a full-time equivalent + 250 EUR gross
per month
  • 40% reduction in normal teaching allocation

HOW TO APPLY

If you are a highly motivated team player, please send your full application (including CV, cover letter, photo and references) to

jobs@amadeus-vienna.com.

Amadeus International School Vienna provides a quality all-round education for students and is committed to safeguarding and

promoting the welfare of children and young people. Candidates must be prepared to undergo child protection screening and appropriate pre-employment checks.

Thank you for understanding that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
